Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.beings

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.beings.LivingBeing
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.beings.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Player
extends LivingBeing
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the player subclass. It is charge of all the attributes that a player would need. It has methods that deal with different attributes and a constructor that spawns and creates a player based on a location on the grid. It inherits properties from the living being super class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Player​(int x, int y)
      This is the constructor for the player subclass.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player​(int x,
              int y)
        This is the constructor for the player subclass. Its parameter is is a position on the grid. When the constructor is called, it will take in the parameter of the position and created the player on that position on the grid. The constructor essentially spawns the player when it is called on.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position on the grid to create the LivingBeing
        y - the y position on the grid to create the LivingBeing

    • Method Detail

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer()
        This method is used to reset the player's position to the spawn point of column 1 row 9. It will be called in the beginning of the game and when the player dies. It will be called at most 3 times.

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        This is the shoot method. Whenever this method is called the player will shoot a bullet in whichever direction the player chooses. Once the bullet makes contact with an enemy, the enemy will die. Will decrease the bullet amount by 1.

      • getBullets

        public int getBullets()
        This is the getBullets method. It returns the number of bullets left in the players gun back to the User Interface class and displays it for the player. Also used to determine whether or not the player can take a shot, if there are no bullets a shot cannot be taken.
        Returns:
        the number of bullets the player has

      • loseLive

        public void loseLive()
        This method is called when the player makes contacts with a ninja. It will be called in the engine first then the method of setPlayer() will be called to reset the position. When the amount of lives reaches 0, the game will stop and display an end game message for losing.

      • getLives

        public int getLives()
        This is the getLives method. It returns the number of lives left that the player has back to the User Interface class and displays it for the player. Also used in GameEngine.
        Returns:
        the number of lives the player has

      • alive

        public boolean alive()
        This is the alive class. Its main purpose is to check if the player has over 0 lives left. If there are no lives left, the game is over and the player has lost.
        Returns:
        true if the player is alive. If the player is dead, the method will return false

      • findBullet

        public void findBullet()
        This method adds a bullet to the player. It will be called when the player picks up the bullet power up.

      • setShield

        public void setShield​(boolean hasShield)
        This method sets the shield the whatever the parameter being passed in is. Used when the power up is picked up, and when it expires.
        Parameters:
        hasShield - whether or not the player should have a shield

      • getShield

        public boolean getShield()
        Gets whether or not the player currently has a shield
        Returns:
        true if the shield is active, false if not
